metadata.title: CVE-2018-16646 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In Poppler 0.68.0, the Parser::getObj() function in Parser.cc may causeinfinite recursion via a crafted file. A remote attacker can leverage thisfor a DoS attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.4
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.4
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.4
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.4
libpoppler73 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.4
poppler-utils - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.62.0-2ubuntu2.4').
